Row.Text: The game will randomly pick one of two races for you to play.

Your civilization has gained [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_religion}[ENDCOLOR] as its dominant religion.
Your civilization no longer has a dominant religion.
Your civilization's dominant Cult within The Weave has changed.
Your civilization can no longer use [ICON_STAR] Mana. Previous accumulation of [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]{1_num}[ENDCOLOR] will be restored if conditions change.
Your civilization can no longer use [ICON_PEACE] Divine Favor. Previous accumulation of [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]{1_num}[ENDCOLOR] will be restored if conditions change.
Hiding Glyphs, Runes & Wards (click to show revealed effects belonging to other players)
Showing revealed Glyphs, Runes & Wards belonging to other players (click to show yours)
Showing Glyphs, Runes & Wards belonging to you (click to hide)

Knowledge Maintenance is currently [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]{1_Num}%[ENDCOLOR] based on [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_Num}[ENDCOLOR] known techs x [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{3_Pop}[ENDCOLOR] total [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens {4_PopInsertTxt} x [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]{5_Num}%[ENDCOLOR] KM per known tech per citizen{6_InsertTxt}. KM is used together with tech-specific modifiers (if any) to calculate research cost for discovering new technologies.
{1_Num} from Leader bonus to non-city income.
{1_Num} from Mercenaries hired by other civilizations.
{1_Num} spent on Mercenaries hired from other civilizations.
{1_Num} spent on current Great Person actions.

Culture Level is a function of total [ICON_CULTURE] Culture generated per [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizen and time. You will gain a new social policy when your Cultural Level exceeds [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] (one greater than the current number of policies you have). Current estimated change in Culture Level per turn is [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_cultureLevelChange}[ENDCOLOR]. Based on current culture generation and population, your Culture Level will slowly approach [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{3_approachingCultureLevel}[ENDCOLOR] over time. In addition to allowying new social policies, high Culture Level can improve your relationships with other full civilizations, particularly with those that are themselves of high Cultural Level.
You are currently generating [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] total [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from the following sources:
{1_Num} from mana depletion by the Fallen.
You have accumulated [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_PEACE] Divine Favor. Only those pursuing the worship of Azzandara accumulate [ICON_PEACE] Divine Favor.

Because your civilization is Fallen, all [ICON_STAR] Mana used is irreversibly consumed. Your civilization has consumed a total of [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] so far, or [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]{2_percentStr}%[ENDCOLOR] of the Sum of all Mana.
You are currently generating [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] total [ICON_PEACE] Divine Favor from the following sources:
You are currently generating [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] total [ICON_STAR] Mana from the following sources:
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] from Leader bonus to non-city sources.
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] from Leader bonus to non-city sources.
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] from Leader bonus to non-city sources.
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] from follower unimproved Forests & Jungles (Cult of Leaves Founder).
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] from follower fresh water (Cult of Abzu Founder).
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] from follower coastal cities (Cult of Ægir Founder).
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] from follower earth resources (Cult of Ploutōn Founder).
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] from follower desert (Cult of Çahra Founder).
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] from Stallions of Epona (Cult of Epona Founder).
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] from follower Grapes and Spirits Buildings (Cult of Bakkheia Founder).

Your civilization has a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Num}%[ENDCOLOR] chance of generating a [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great Person per turn based on [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_Num}[ENDCOLOR] currently existing and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{3_Num}[ENDCOLOR] total points.
Your civilization cannot generate any [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great People until it has earned a name.
The liklihood for a specific Great Person class is proportional to the number of points accumulated below (specific subclasses may be generated depending on civilization factors):
[ICON_PEACE] Divine Favor is used in the casting of spells by Azzandara followers.
[ICON_STAR] Mana is used in the casting of spells.

This indicates the unit's melee strength [ICON_STRENGTH], ranged strength [ICON_RANGE_STRENGTH] and morale ([ICON_HAPPINESS_1] or [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] if positive or negative). Morale modifies a unit's melee and ranged strength.

The civilization will give up Maleficium and all its enabled technologies plus all (Anti-)Theism policies. All spellcasters belonging to the civilization will desert it, going rogue for a time and possibly joining other Fallen civilizations.

The Fallen (followers of Aŋra and those that know Maleficium) have begun to consume mana at a dangerous rate. Mana is the material fabric of Éa and all things in it, and it cannot be replenished. If this process goes unchecked, the weave of the world will begin to fray. It will eventually come apart at the seams.

Other civilizations have begun to take note of your use of mana. They feel that its consumption may damage the world. But it is a silly concern: the Sum of All Mana is quite large. Perhaps they will move on to more immediate problems.

The Sum of All Mana has been depleted below 95%. Undead begin to spawn from old battlefields and city graveyards, and demons from breach plots (1% chance per plot per turn increasing to 10% as the Sum of All Mana depletes to zero).

The Sum of All Mana has been depleted below 90%. The effect begins to sap the happiness and health of from all civilizations (2 unhappiness and unhealth increasing to 20 as the Sum of All Mana approaches zero).

The Sum of All Mana has been depleted below 80%. Blight begins to spread from already blighted plots, and breach from already breached plots. The rate of spread increases as the Sum of All Mana depletes to zero.

The Sum of All Mana has been depleted below 70%. The world is corrupted by a surge of blight affecting 1 out of every 20 plots. All mana accumulative processes are reduced by 33% (and reduced further toward 90% as the Sum of All Mana depletes to zero).

The Sum of All Mana has been depleted below 60%. The fabric of the world begins to tear: 1 out of every 40 plots become Breached. Blight begins to appear spontaneously (2.5% chance per unaffected plot per turn increasing to 10% as the Sum of All Mana depletes to zero).

The Sum of All Mana has been depleted below 50%. Pestilence, the first of the Four Horsemen, arrives riding a White Horse. He carries the Sickening Bow and the Plague Crown which cause (respectively) sickness in all units and plague in all cities that he attacks.

The Sum of All Mana has been depleted below 40%. War arrives riding a Red Horse. He carries a sword (also called War) that causes nearby civilizations to sever relationships and war upon each other, and the cities and units of larger civilizations to revolt and war upon their owners.
The Sum of All Mana has been depleted below 30%. Famine arrives riding a Black Horse. He carries the Scales of Insolvency which bring starvation to all nearby units and cities.
The Sum of All Mana has been depleted below 20%. Death arrives riding a Pale Horse. He carries no items but kills by sword, famine, plague and the enraged animals and beasts of Ea.

The Sum of All Mana has been depleted below 10%. Breach begins to appear spontaneously. Both breach and blight accelerate in their rate of spread. The spawning rate of demons (from breach) and undead (from killing fields left by the Four Horsemen) accelerates rapidly.
from Followers of Aŋra in this City
from Consumption of Mana by the Fallen
You have met a Major Spirit of Éa, {1_CivName:textkey}.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{2_GiftString}[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{3_SpeakAgainString}

You are the first great empire to meet this god and have been awarded a gift of [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_NumGold} [ICON_GOLD] Gold[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_NumFaith} [ICON_STAR] Mana[ENDCOLOR].
You have been awarded a gift of [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_NumGold} [ICON_GOLD] Gold[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_NumFaith} [ICON_STAR] Mana[ENDCOLOR].
(If you wish to speak with {1_CivName:textkey} again, click on the god's name in the Diplomacy menu.)
You have achieved civilization naming conditions for [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Name}[ENDCOLOR]. What would you like to do?
You will be asked again when you end this turn
Wait for another civilization-defining event to occur. This option is allowed only once!
(Click CTRL to cycle a, á, à, ä, â, å, æ, etc.[NEWLINE]Try after: AaEeIiOoUuYyTtNnCcRr.)
